oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1958-05-03 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from May 3, 1958. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Roy Acuff (host/performer) with his Smoky Mountain Boys (including Howdy Forrester, June Webb, Bashful Brother Oswald, and Jimmy Riddle), guest performer Benny Martin, and regular performers the Old Hickory Singers, June Carter, and Pap's Jug Band. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 969th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Old Hickory Singers; Benny Martin; Howdy Forrester; June Webb
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- Roll On Buddy, Roll On (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Roy Acuff) -- Roy Acuff introduces the Old Hickory Singers -- When The Red, Red Robin Comes Bob, Bob, Bobbin' Along (Old Hickory Singers) -- Roy Acuff introduces Benny Martin -- I Saw Your Face In The Moon (Benny Martin) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Roy Acuff) -- Roy Acuff introduces Howdy Forrester -- Liberty (Howdy Forrester fiddle) -- Roy Acuff introduces June Webb -- I'm So Lonesome I Could Cry (June Webb) -- Roy Acuff talks -- Lord Build Me A Cabin In Gloryland (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Roy Acuff introduces Jimmy Riddle
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; United States.
